H0.text: Mixing salt and pepper is the best example of a solution that Louisa needs to demonstrate to her class.

H1.text: Melting butter is the best example of a solution that Louisa needs to demonstrate to her class.

H2.text: Stirring salt into water is the best example of a solution that Louisa needs to demonstrate to her class.

H3.text: Melting an ice cube is the best example of a solution for Louisa to demonstrate to her class.

A4.text: A mixture of salt (sodium chloride) and silica may be separated by dissolving the salt in water, and filtering off the undissolved silica.

A5.text: The synthesis of chemical compounds... both make use of the relative solubilities of the desired product, as well as unreacted starting materials, byproducts, and side products to achieve separation.
